cnd18:0.3: 17. Extolling the Way to the Far Shore
cnd18:1.1: (Chapter title abbreviated; the full title is _Explanation of the Verses
cnd18:1.2: Extolling the Way to the Far Shore_.)
cnd18:2.2: When he lived in the Pāsānạka Cetiya (Rock Temple) in Magadha.
cnd18:2.3: To the sixteen Brāhmaṇas who served Bāvari,
cnd18:2.4: He answered the questions of those who asked one by one.
cnd18:2.6: When he lived in the Pāsānạka Cetiya (Rock Temple) in Magadha.
cnd18:2.7: To the sixteen Brāhmaṇas who served Bāvari,
cnd18:2.8: He answered the questions of those who asked one by one.
cnd18:2.10: When he lived in the Pāsānạka Cetiya (Rock Temple) in Magadha.
cnd18:2.11: To the sixteen Brāhmaṇas who served Bāvari,
cnd18:2.12: He answered the questions of those who asked one by one.
cnd18:2.14: When he lived in the Pāsānạka Cetiya (Rock Temple) in Magadha.
cnd18:2.15: To the sixteen Brāhmaṇas who served Bāvari,
cnd18:2.16: He answered the questions of those who asked one by one.
cnd18:3.1: "The Blessed One said this": Speaking of the way to the far shore. "The Blessed
cnd18:3.2: One" is synonymous with respect. In addition, the "greed breaker" is the Blessed
cnd18:3.3: One; the "sickness destroyer" is the Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed
cnd18:3.4: conceit" is the Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed the thorns" is the
cnd18:3.5: Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed the pollutants" is Blessed One; "the one
cnd18:3.6: who has ended" is the Blessed One; "the one who has practiced the body, the
cnd18:3.7: precepts, the mind, and the wisdom" is the Blessed One; or "the Blessed One is
cnd18:3.8: close to the woods, wild forests, and border dwellings (sitting place), where
cnd18:3.9: speaking is lessened, it is quiet, away from the human atmosphere, alone, and
cnd18:3.10: suitable for sitting alone" is the Blessed One; or "the Blessed One is the one
cnd18:3.11: who divides clothes, food, shelter, the needs of patients, and medical
cnd18:3.12: necessities"; or "the Blessed One is the one who has the taste of righteousness,
cnd18:3.13: the taste of Dhamma, the taste of liberation, the increased precepts, the mind,
cnd18:3.14: and the wisdom"; or "the Blessed One is the four types of jhāna, the four
cnd18:3.15: immeasurables, the four formlessness, etc., the one who divides is the Blessed
cnd18:3.16: One"; or the Blessed One is the one who has the eighth liberation, the eight
cnd18:3.17: victories, the ninth dwelling place, etc.; or the Blessed One is the practice of
cnd18:3.18: ten thoughts, (ten) abidings, the one who (observes) the in and out of breath;
cnd18:3.19: the one who is purely divided is the Blessed One; or the Blessed One divides the
cnd18:3.20: four mindfulness, the four righteousness, the four divine bases (iddhipāda), the
cnd18:3.21: five faculties, the five powers, the seven enlightenment factors, and the eight
cnd18:3.22: branches of the holy path; or the Blessed One is ten Tathāgata, four
cnd18:3.23: fearlessness, four unobstructed solutions, six supernatural powers and the six
cnd18:3.24: enlightenment methods. "Blessed One," this name is not given by the mother; not
cnd18:3.25: given by the father; not given by brothers; not given by sisters; not given by
cnd18:3.26: friends; not given by relatives; not given by Samaṇas or Brāhmaṇas; not given by
cnd18:3.27: heaven; it is ultimate liberation; the establishment (of the pseudonym) for the
cnd18:3.28: acquisition and testimony of the Buddha, the Blessed One, under the Bodhi tree,
cnd18:3.29: and all knowledge and wisdom, that is, the Blessed One. The Blessed One said
cnd18:4.1: "Living in Magadha," when living in the kingdom of Magadha, acting, going on,
cnd18:4.2: guarding, and surviving. "When the Buddha lived at the Rock Temple," Buddha
cnd18:4.3: living at the Rock Temple is called the Buddha being seated there.
cnd18:5.1: "To the sixteen Brāhmaṇas who serve": Brāhmaṇas of Piṅgiya are the followers,
cnd18:5.2: attendants, servants, and disciples of Bāvari, and Piṅgiya and those are
cnd18:5.3: sixteen. Or, those sixteen Brāhmaṇas are followers, attendants, servants, and
cnd18:5.4: disciples of the Buddha, the Blessed One.
cnd18:6.1: "He answered the questions requested and questioned, one by one": "Requested,"
cnd18:6.2: sought, desired. "All asked," All questioned one by one; all asked one by one;
cnd18:6.3: all one by one begged; all requested; all asked to be made clear. "He answered
cnd18:6.4: the questions," he answered, explained, taught, informed, established,
cnd18:7.1: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd18:7.2: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd18:7.3: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd18:7.4: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd18:7.5: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd18:7.6: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd18:7.7: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd18:7.8: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd18:7.9: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd18:7.10: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd18:7.11: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd18:7.12: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd18:7.13: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd18:7.14: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd18:7.15: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd18:7.16: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd18:7.17: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd18:7.18: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd18:7.19: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd18:7.20: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd18:7.21: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd18:7.22: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd18:7.23: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd18:7.24: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd18:7.25: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd18:7.26: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd18:7.27: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd18:7.28: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd18:7.29: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd18:7.30: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd18:7.31: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd18:7.32: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd18:7.33: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd18:7.34: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd18:7.35: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd18:7.36: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd18:8.1: "As there is a question": As there are more questions from Ajita, as there are
cnd18:8.2: more questions from Tissa Metteya, one question from Punṇạka and Mettagū, as
cnd18:8.3: there are also questions from Dhotaka, I also deal with the problems of Upasīva,
cnd18:8.4: Nanda and Hemaka, as I also deal with the problems of Todeyya, and as I also
cnd18:8.5: deal with the two questions of Kappa, they are the same with the virtuous
cnd18:8.6: Jatukanṇị̄. As it is also a question from Bhadrāvudha, as it is also a question
cnd18:8.7: from Udaya, as it is also a question from Posāla, as it is also a question from
cnd18:8.8: Mogharāja, as it is also a question from Piṅgiya.
cnd18:9.1: "After knowing the reason, after knowing the Dhamma": The question is the of
cnd18:9.2: Dhamma, and the answer is the truth. After knowing the reason, after
cnd18:9.3: understanding, after weighing, after judging, after separating, after
cnd18:9.4: clarifying. "After knowing the Dhamma," after knowing the Dhamma, after
cnd18:9.5: understanding, .... In order to know the truth, after knowing the Dhamma. "Able
cnd18:9.6: to follow the Dhamma and practice": The correct way, following the way, the way
cnd18:9.7: that is not reversed, the way that has no contradiction, such as the meaning of
cnd18:9.8: the way, the way he can implement.
cnd18:10.1: "He can walk to the other shore of age and death": The other shore of age and
cnd18:10.2: death is called non-living, Nibbāna, that is the cessation of all actions, the
cnd18:10.3: cessation of all attachments, the extinction of craving, greed, annihilation,
cnd18:10.4: and Nibbāna. "He can walk to the other shore of age and death": He can walk to
cnd18:10.5: the other shore of age and death, can prove the other shore, can touch the other
cnd18:10.6: shore, and can testify to the other shore.
cnd18:11.1: "These Dhammas can go to the other shore": These Dhammas can go to the other
cnd18:11.2: shore, they make one to reach the other shore, reach the other shore completely,
cnd18:11.3: and they lead to the death of age and death.
cnd18:12.1: "Therefore the teachings of these Dhammas": "Therefore," the reason, the
cnd18:12.2: condition, the cause, when you see this fault in the attachment. "The teaching
cnd18:12.3: of these Dhammas is for this way to the far shore." For this reason these
cnd18:12.4: dhammas are taught. "Synonymously with 'the way to the far shore'": The far
cnd18:12.5: shore is called non-living, Nibbāna.... This is called the Path, that is: right
cnd18:12.6: view.... "Synonym": name, appellation, common name, naming, vocabulary, phrase.
cnd18:12.7: Synonymous with "the way to the far shore."
cnd18:13.1: <em>95 : Ajita, Tissa Metteya, Punṇạka and Mettagū,
cnd18:13.2: as well as Dhotaka, Upasīva, Nanda and Hemaka,
cnd18:13.3: <em>95 : Ajita, Tissa Metteya, Punṇạka and Mettagū,
cnd18:13.4: as well as Dhotaka, Upasīva, Nanda and Hemaka,
cnd18:14.1: <em>96 : Todeyya and Kappa, and the virtuous Jatukanṇị̄,
cnd18:14.2: As well as Bhadrāvudha, Udaya, and the Brāhmaṇa Posāla,
cnd18:14.3: The clever Mogharāja, with the great rishi Piṅgiya.
cnd18:14.4: <em>96 : Todeyya and Kappa, and the virtuous Jatukanṇị̄,
cnd18:14.5: As well as Bhadrāvudha, Udaya, and the Brāhmaṇa Posāla,
cnd18:14.6: The clever Mogharāja, with the great rishi Piṅgiya.
cnd18:14.7: <em>96 : Todeyya and Kappa, and the virtuous Jatukanṇị̄,
cnd18:14.8: As well as Bhadrāvudha, Udaya, and the Brāhmaṇa Posāla,
cnd18:14.9: The clever Mogharāja, with the great rishi Piṅgiya.
cnd18:15.2: The great rishi with excellent deeds,
cnd18:15.6: The great rishi with excellent deeds,
cnd18:15.10: The great rishi with excellent deeds,
cnd18:15.14: The great rishi with excellent deeds,
cnd18:16.1: "They approach to the enlightened one": "They," sixteen Brāhmaṇas, for the way
cnd18:16.2: to the far shore. "Enlightened One" that is the one who has enlightened the
cnd18:16.3: truth in the Dhamma that has not been heard before, and reaches the state of all
cnd18:16.4: knowing there, and the state of freedom in strength. What does "enlightened one"
cnd18:16.5: mean to be an enlightened one? "The one who feels the truth" is the enlightened
cnd18:16.6: one, the "makes the living being aware"..., the state of all knowing..., the
cnd18:16.7: state of all seeing, and the state that is not guided by others is the
cnd18:16.8: enlightened. Those who have flowed out are the enlightened ones, those who have
cnd18:16.9: exhausted their troubles are given names as enlightened ones, those who have no
cnd18:16.10: troubles..., those who have always been free from greed are enlightened, and
cnd18:16.11: those who have always been free from hatred. For the enlightened person, "the
cnd18:16.12: one who has always been away from ignorance" is the enlightened person, "the one
cnd18:16.13: who has always been free from pollution"..., the one who has crossed the road
cnd18:16.14: without crossroads..., and the one who has been alone is enlightened without
cnd18:16.15: (having been instructed). For the enlightened person, the state of not being
cnd18:16.16: killed is the enlightened person, and the state of being enlightened is the
cnd18:16.17: enlightened person. "Enlightened person," this name is not given (made) by the
cnd18:16.18: mother, not given by the father, not ...by the brothers, ...sisters, ...friends,
cnd18:16.19: relatives; Samaṇas or Brāhmaṇas; not given my heaven, this is ultimate
cnd18:16.20: liberation; the establishment (pseudonym) of the acquisition and testimony of
cnd18:16.21: the Buddha, the Blessed One, and the Bodhi tree, together with all knowledge and
cnd18:16.22: wisdom, is the enlightened one. "They approach the enlightened one": They
cnd18:16.23: approach, see, visit, ask, and question the enlightened one.
cnd18:17.1: "The rishi with sufficient action": The action is called the arising of the vow,
cnd18:17.2: and the self-control of the vow is action; the self-control of the root is also
cnd18:17.3: action; it is also action to know the right amount of diet; it is also action to
cnd18:17.4: specialize in sobriety; the seven principles [MN.53] are also action; the four
cnd18:17.5: meditations are also actions. "Those with sufficient actions," those with
cnd18:17.6: sufficient actions, the best actions, the highest actions, the first actions,
cnd18:17.7: the winning actions, and the top actions. "The rishi," why is the Blessed One
cnd18:17.8: the Great rishi? The "seekers, and pursuers of the great precepts" are the great
cnd18:17.9: rishis. ...of the great concentration..., ...of the great liberation
cnd18:17.10: aggregate..., "the seeker and pursuer of the great liberation of wisdom and
cnd18:17.11: insight" is the great rishi; the fragments gathered by the dark..., the
cnd18:17.12: destruction of the great upside down..., the pulling out of the big arrow of
cnd18:17.13: thirst..., the unraveling of the accumulation of sight..., the lifting of the
cnd18:17.14: big conceit flag, ...the calming of the great work..., the calming of the big
cnd18:17.15: torrent..., the laying down of the heavy burden..., the severance of the cycle
cnd18:17.16: of the great reincarnation..., the disappearance of the great heat..., the
cnd18:17.17: cessation of the great heat..., "the seeker and the pursuer who lifts the flag
cnd18:17.18: of Dhamma in his heart" is the great rishi; the great minds..., the great
cnd18:17.19: exertion..., the great divine bases..., the great roots..., the power..., the
cnd18:17.20: great enlightenment branches..., the big eight branches of the holy path...,
cnd18:17.21: "the immortality of the great supreme benefit, the seeker of Nibbāna, the
cnd18:17.22: pursuer" is great rishi; "sought, pursued, and searched for by powerful beings:
cnd18:17.23: Where is the Buddha? Where is the Blessed One? Where is the god among the gods?
cnd18:17.24: Where is the bull king among people?" Such is the great rishi.
cnd18:18.1: "Asking subtle questions": "Asking," inquiring, begging, asking; making it
cnd18:18.2: clear. "Subtle questions," deep, hard to see, hard to follow, and silent,
cnd18:18.3: triumphant, non-theoretical, delicate, and experienced by the wise.
cnd18:19.1: "Close to the most victorious Enlightened One": "Enlightened One," That is the
cnd18:19.2: Blessed One.... "The most victorious," the first, the most victorious, the
cnd18:19.3: great, the superior, the highest, the most winning, the top enlightened one,
cnd18:19.4: they approach, come close to, meet, visit, inquire, and ask.
cnd18:20.1: <em>98 : The enlightened person thoroughly answered for them,
cnd18:20.5: <em>98 : The enlightened person thoroughly answered for them,
cnd18:20.9: <em>98 : The enlightened person thoroughly answered for them,
cnd18:20.13: <em>98 : The enlightened person thoroughly answered for them,
cnd18:21.1: "The Enlightened One provides a thorough answer for them": "For them," for the
cnd18:21.2: sixteen Brāhmaṇas, of the way to the far shore. "The Enlightened One," ....
cnd18:21.3: "Thorough answers," the enlightened one thoroughly answers, explains, teaches,
cnd18:21.4: informs, establishes, uncovers, analyzes, and clarifies for them.
cnd18:22.1: "Questions asked, truthfully": "Questions asked," questions asked, questioned,
cnd18:22.2: begged, requested, and made clear. "As they are," explain like that as it should
cnd18:22.3: be explained; teach like that as it should be taught; tell like that as it
cnd18:22.4: should be told; build like that as it should be built; uncover like that as it
cnd18:22.5: should be uncovered; unfold like that as it should be unfolded; parse like that
cnd18:22.6: as it should be parsed; clarify like that as it should be clarified; what should
cnd18:22.7: be stated is stated like that.
cnd18:23.1: "To answer questions": To answer questions, explain, teach, inform, establish,
cnd18:24.1: 'Muni satisfied the Brāhmaṇas": "Satisfy," make satisfaction, expand
cnd18:24.2: satisfaction, make clear, make joy, and produce pleasure. "Brāhmaṇas," ....
cnd18:24.3: "Muni" is called wisdom, that is wisdom, understanding, simple selection,
cnd18:24.4: investigation, discernment, recognition, discrimination, close observation,
cnd18:24.5: inspection, learned virtuous wisdom, proficiency, cleverness, study, reflection,
cnd18:24.6: review, contemplation, examination, general comprehensive wisdom, vipassanā,
cnd18:24.7: right knowledge, stabbing rod, wisdom root, wisdom sword, wisdom palace, wisdom
cnd18:24.8: brightness, wisdom light, no delusion, choice of dhamma, right view. The Blessed
cnd18:24.9: One has the wisdom of Muni, reaching Muni. There are three Muni (perfect
cnd18:24.10: virtues): body Muni, language Muni, intention Muni.
cnd18:25.1: What is the body of Muni? The three types of body and evil deeds are cut off as
cnd18:25.2: the Muni position; the three types of good behaviors are the Muni position; the
cnd18:25.3: wisdom in the body is the Muni position; the knowledge of the body is the Muni
cnd18:25.4: position; walking the Path with (higher) knowledge is the body of Muni; the
cnd18:25.5: abandonment of desire and greed, cut off, as the Muni; the fourth jhāna
cnd18:25.6: extinction of the body is the position of Muni.
cnd18:26.1: What is the language of Muni? The abandonment of the four types of evil deeds of
cnd18:26.2: language is the position of Muni; the four types of good acts of language are
cnd18:26.3: the position of Muni; the wisdom of linguistic objects is the position of Muni;
cnd18:26.4: the knowledge of language is the position of Muni; and knowing the path of all
cnd18:26.5: acts is the position of Muni; the abandonment of desire and greed of language is
cnd18:26.6: the position of Muni; the second jhāna cessation of language is the position of
cnd18:27.1: What is intention Muni? The three types of deeds of intention and evil deeds are
cnd18:27.2: the Muni position; the three types of good deeds are the Muni position; the
cnd18:27.3: wisdom in the mind-object is the Muni position; the knowledge of the heart is
cnd18:27.4: the Muni position; the one that walks the Path with knowledge is the position of
cnd18:27.5: Muni; the desire and greed of the heart being judged is the position of Muni;
cnd18:27.6: the desire to perish the mind is the position of Muni.
cnd18:28.1: "Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
cnd18:28.2: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say he is the one who cuts everything.
cnd18:28.3: Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
cnd18:28.4: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say that they are those who have been cleansed of evil."
cnd18:29.1: The six types of Muni have these three modes of Muni: Muni at home, Muni without
cnd18:29.2: a home, Muni with learning, Muni without learning, Bhikkhu Muni, Muni (of the)
cnd18:29.3: Muni. Which is at home? Those laymen who have seen the footsteps and have
cnd18:29.4: learned the precepts, these are at home. Which are homeless Muni? Those bhikkhus
cnd18:29.5: who have seen the footsteps and who have learned the precepts are homeless Muni.
cnd18:29.6: There are seven types of learning for learning Muni, Arahant for non-learning
cnd18:29.7: Muni, and Bhikkhu Buddha as Bhikkhu Muni. Muni (of) Muni is called Tathāgata,
cnd18:30.1: "Non-wise is Muni, a foolish and ignorant man,
cnd18:30.2: After raising the scale, take the top one and become a wise man.
cnd18:30.3: Avoid all evils, that Muni became Muni because of that,
cnd18:30.4: Everyone who understands the (inner and outer sum) in the world,
cnd18:30.5: Because that is said to be Muni.
cnd18:30.6: Who knows all the inside and outside of the world,
cnd18:30.7: The unwholesome and the good behind the Dhamma,
cnd18:30.8: Everyone who is supported (respected) by heaven and man,
cnd18:30.9: Beyond staining and the net, he is Muni."
cnd18:31.1: <em>99 : They, satisfied by the all-seeing one,
cnd18:31.2: The enlightened, he of the sun tribe,
cnd18:31.3: Lived a spiritual life in front of the noble and wise.
cnd18:31.4: <em>99 : They, satisfied by the all-seeing one,
cnd18:31.5: The enlightened, he of the sun tribe,
cnd18:31.6: Lived a spiritual life in front of the noble and wise.
cnd18:31.7: <em>99 : They, satisfied by the all-seeing one,
cnd18:31.8: The enlightened, he of the sun tribe,
cnd18:31.9: Lived a spiritual life in front of the noble and wise.
cnd18:32.1: "They are satisfied by the all-seeing one": "They," ... "Satisfied," ....
cnd18:32.2: "All-seeing," all-eyes are called the state of all knowing wisdom. The Blessed
cnd18:32.3: One has the state of intelligence, of fully having, entering, fully entering,
cnd18:32.4: sufficiently having, having all the knowledge.
cnd18:33.1: "For him, there is nothing unseen here (in this world),
cnd18:33.2: There is no knowledge that cannot be known,
cnd18:33.3: He proves that everything that exists should be guided by inference,
cnd18:33.4: Because the Tathāgata, like that, is all-eyes."
cnd18:34.1: "The enlightened person, the person of the sun tribe": "The enlightened person,"
cnd18:34.2: .... "Sun tribe": Sun (ādicco) is called the sun (sūriyo), his surname is
cnd18:34.3: Gotama, the Blessed One is also a surnamed Gotama, the Blessed One is a relative
cnd18:34.4: of the sun surname, so the enlightened person is a member of the sun tribe.
cnd18:35.1: "Live a spiritual life (doing Brahma)": Brahma is called separation, abstinence,
cnd18:35.2: withdrawal, renunciation, detachment, no action, no misdeed, no offense, no
cnd18:35.3: transgression, no destruction of the bridge Or, because there is no difference,
cnd18:35.4: the Brahma is called the eight noble paths, namely: right view, right will,
cnd18:35.5: right speech, right kamma, right life, right effort, right thought, right
cnd18:35.6: concentration. "They do Brahma": They do, practice, and turn to Brahma after
cnd18:36.1: "In front of the noble and wise": The noble and the first, the most wise, the
cnd18:36.2: supremely wise, the uppermost wise, the highest wise, the top wise. "In front,"
cnd18:37.2: As taught by the enlightened person,
cnd18:37.3: Anyone who can practice like that
cnd18:37.4: Can walk from this shore to the other shore.
cnd18:37.6: As taught by the enlightened person,
cnd18:37.7: Anyone who can practice like that
cnd18:37.8: Can walk from this shore to the other shore.
cnd18:37.10: As taught by the enlightened person,
cnd18:37.11: Anyone who can practice like that
cnd18:37.12: Can walk from this shore to the other shore.
cnd18:37.14: As taught by the enlightened person,
cnd18:37.15: Anyone who can practice like that
cnd18:37.16: Can walk from this shore to the other shore.
cnd18:38.1: "One by one questions": One by one questions by Ajita, ...(omitted), ...by
cnd18:39.1: "As taught by the enlightened person": "Enlightened one," .... As explained,
cnd18:40.1: "Anyone who can practice like that": He can practice the right way, follow the
cnd18:40.2: way, the way that is not opposite, the way of righteousness, and the way of the
cnd18:41.1: "Able to walk from this shore to the other shore": The other shore is called
cnd18:41.2: non-living, Nibbāna...; this shore is called pollution, aggregates, and
cnd18:41.3: creations. "Can walk from this shore to the other shore": He can walk from this
cnd18:41.4: shore to the other shore, can prove to the other shore, touch the other shore,
cnd18:41.5: and testify to the other shore.
